Test Plans - Payment Module UAT

Overview
This document outlines the comprehensive test plan for the Payment Module UAT phase.

Scope
Payment processing flow
Error handling and edge cases
Integration with payment gateway
User acceptance criteria

Test Objectives
1. Validate payment initiation process
2. Verify transaction settlement
3. Test error scenarios and recovery
4. Ensure compliance with payment standards

Test Coverage
Positive Scenarios: 25 test cases
Negative Scenarios: 15 test cases
Edge Cases: 10 test cases

Timeline
Start Date: 2026-02-01
End Date: 2026-02-15
UAT Sign-off: 2026-02-20

Success Criteria
100% of critical paths executed
0 critical defects
Business sign-off obtained
Performance benchmarks met

Resources
QA Lead: Vikram
Test Environment: UAT
Test Data: Prepared dataset with 1000 test records

Test Strategy Documents

Strategy Overview
Our testing strategy focuses on comprehensive coverage across functional, non-functional, and integration testing.

Testing Levels
1. Unit Testing: Developer-owned, 80% code coverage target
2. Integration Testing: Testing module interactions
3. System Testing: End-to-end business flow validation
4. UAT: Business acceptance validation

Testing Types
Functional Testing
Performance Testing (Load/Stress)
Security Testing
Usability Testing
Regression Testing

Quality Gates
Gate | Entry Criteria | Exit Criteria
Unit Test | Code complete | 80% code coverage
Integration | Unit tests pass | All integrations verified
System | Integration complete | Critical paths pass
UAT | System test sign-off | Business sign-off

Risk Assessment
High Risk Areas: Payment gateway integration, data security
Medium Risk: Concurrent transaction handling
Low Risk: UI validation

Automation Strategy
Automate regression suite (70% coverage target)
Manual testing for exploratory and UAT scenarios
CI/CD integration for continuous testing

RTM - Requirement Traceability Matrix

Document Purpose
This RTM maps business requirements to test cases, ensuring complete coverage and traceability.

Mapping Structure
Requirement ID | Requirement Description | Test Case ID | Status
REQ-001 | User shall initiate payment transaction | TC-001, TC-002 | Mapped
REQ-002 | System shall validate payment amount | TC-003, TC-004 | Mapped
REQ-003 | System shall handle payment timeout | TC-005, TC-006, TC-007 | Mapped
REQ-004 | System shall retry failed transactions | TC-008, TC-009 | Mapped
REQ-005 | System shall log all transactions | TC-010, TC-011 | Mapped
REQ-006 | System shall encrypt payment data | TC-012, TC-013 | Mapped
REQ-007 | User shall receive payment confirmation | TC-014, TC-015 | Mapped

Coverage Summary
Total Requirements: 7
Mapped Requirements: 7 (100%)
Total Test Cases: 15
Coverage Gap: 0%

Traceability Metrics
Forward Traceability: âœ… Complete
Backward Traceability: âœ… Complete
Orphan Requirements: 0
Orphan Test Cases: 0

User Stories - Payment Features

Story 1: Quick Payment Checkout
As a customer
I want to complete payment in less than 30 seconds
So that I have a smooth purchasing experience

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Payment page loads within 2 seconds
2. User can enter payment details in less than 20 seconds
3. Confirmation received within 8 seconds after submission
Story Points: 8

Story 2: Payment Error Recovery
As a customer
I want to recover from payment failures automatically
So that I don't lose my transaction

Acceptance Criteria:
1. System retries failed transactions up to 3 times
2. User is notified of failure with clear error message
3. Transaction is rolled back safely if all retries fail
4. User can retry manually without re-entering data
Story Points: 13

Story 3: Transaction History
As a user
I want to view all my payment transactions
So that I can track my spending

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Display last 100 transactions by default
2. Searchable by date range, amount, status
3. Export to CSV available
4. Real-time updates for recent transactions
Story Points: 5

Story 4: Payment Security
As a user
I want my payment data to be encrypted
So that I feel secure making online transactions

Acceptance Criteria:
1. All sensitive data encrypted in transit (TLS 1.3)
2. PCI-DSS compliance verified
3. CVV not stored in system
4. Regular security audits performed
Story Points: 21

Regression Scope Documents

Purpose
This document defines the scope of regression testing for the payment module after each release.

Regression Testing Scope

Core Payment Flow (Critical)
Payment initiation
Amount validation
Payment gateway integration
Transaction settlement
Confirmation receipt

Error Handling (High)
Network timeout scenarios
Invalid payment details
Insufficient funds
Duplicate transaction prevention
Failed payment recovery

Integration Points (Medium)
CRM system integration
Reporting system sync
Email notification service
Audit logging

Edge Cases (Medium)
Concurrent payment processing
High transaction volume
Different currency handling
Multiple payment methods

Test Case Selection Strategy
Smoke Tests: 5 critical test cases (5 minutes)
Sanity Tests: 20 core test cases (30 minutes)
Full Regression: 60 test cases (4 hours)

Entry/Exit Criteria

Entry Criteria:
Build deployed to test environment
Previous regression suite passed
Test data refreshed

Exit Criteria:
100% critical test cases passed
95% overall pass rate
No blocking defects
Performance baseline met

Defect RCA - Payment Timeout Issue

Defect Details
ID: DEFECT-2026-042
Severity: Critical
Status: Resolved
Date Reported: 2026-01-15
Date Resolved: 2026-01-22

Symptom
Users experience payment timeout errors during peak hours (3-5 PM), occurring in approximately 5% of transactions.

Impact
Business Impact: Lost transactions worth ~$10K/day
User Impact: 500+ users affected
Revenue Impact: Estimated $150K monthly loss

Root Cause Analysis

Primary Cause
Payment gateway connection pool exhausted during peak load. Gateway timeout set to 30 seconds but average response time increased to 35 seconds during peak hours.

Contributing Factors
1. Database query optimization issue in transaction lookup (N+1 problem)
2. Insufficient connection pooling (50 connections, should be 200+)
3. Missing circuit breaker pattern for gateway failures
4. No request queuing mechanism

Environment Details
Load: 1000+ concurrent users
Gateway API Response Time (normal): 2-5 seconds
Gateway API Response Time (peak): 35-45 seconds
Database Query Time: 800ms (should be <100ms)

Solution Implemented
1. Database Optimization: Added indexes on transaction lookup queries (-87% query time)
2. Connection Pooling: Increased to 200 connections with auto-scaling
3. Circuit Breaker: Implemented to fail fast on gateway errors
4. Request Queuing: Added queue with max wait time 10 seconds
5. Timeout Extension: Extended to 60 seconds with backoff retry

Verification
Load testing with 5000 concurrent users: âœ… Pass
24-hour production monitoring: âœ… 0 timeout errors
Regression testing: âœ… All 60 test cases pass

Prevention Measures
Implement automated load testing in CI/CD pipeline
Set up proactive monitoring and alerting
Monthly performance baseline review
Capacity planning for peak seasons

Migration Guide

Testing
âœ… Unit Test Coverage: 95%
âœ… Integration Tests: 100% pass
âœ… Load Testing: Verified with 5000 concurrent users
âœ… UAT: Approved by business

Support
For issues or questions, contact: support@payment.company.com

FAQ - Payment Module Known Issues

Frequently Asked Questions

Q1: Why is my payment timing out?
A: Payment timeouts typically occur during peak hours (3-5 PM). The system now includes automatic retry logic. If the issue persists, contact support with your transaction ID.
Related Test Cases: TC-005, TC-006, TC-007

Q2: How long does transaction settlement take?
A: Most transactions settle within 2-4 hours. International payments may take 24-48 hours depending on the bank.
Related Test Cases: TC-010, TC-011

Q3: Is my payment data secure?
A: Yes. All payment data is encrypted using TLS 1.3 and we are PCI-DSS Level 1 compliant. CVV numbers are never stored.
Related Test Cases: TC-012, TC-013

Q4: Can I retry a failed payment?
A: Yes. The system automatically retries failed payments up to 3 times. You can also manually retry from your transaction history.
Related Test Cases: TC-008, TC-009

Q5: What payment methods are supported?
A: We support: Credit Cards (Visa, MasterCard, Amex), Debit Cards, Digital Wallets (Apple Pay, Google Pay), Bank Transfers (ACH)
Related Test Cases: TC-001, TC-002, TC-003

Known Issues
Issue | Severity | Status | Workaround
International payments incur 2.5% fee | Medium | Known | Use bank transfer for lower fees
Refunds process in 24 hours | Low | By Design | Plan accordingly
High concurrent load (>5000 users) | Critical | Resolved in v2.1.0 | Update to latest version

Reporting Issues
If you encounter any issues not listed above:
1. Collect transaction ID and timestamp
2. Note error message and steps to reproduce
3. Contact: support@payment.company.com
4. Include: Browser type, payment method, amount
